japanese:
あら、一花だわ。
なにを見てるのかしら？
translation:
Oh, it's Ichika.
What are you looking at?

japanese:
おい……。
あいつ、泡盛の店の前でなにやってんだ。
translation:
Hey...
What're you doing in front of the Awamori shop?

japanese: 一花、酒はダメだぞ。
translation: Ichika, drinking alcohol is NOT good, you know.

japanese: えっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
ああ、フータロー君に二乃か。
びっくりした。
translation:
Oh, Futaro-kun and Nino?
That's surprising.

japanese:
ちゃんとわかってるよ。
自分用じゃないから安心して。
translation:
I know that Futaro-kun.
Don't worry, it's not for me.

japanese: もしかして、お父さんへのお土産？
translation: Is it a souvenir for our father?

japanese:
うん、沖縄っぽいものなら
泡盛がいいかなって思ったんだ。
translation:
Yeah, I thought Awamori would be good
as it's a typical Okinawan souvenir.

japanese:
昨日、四葉も同じことを考えてたけど、
お父さんがお酒飲んでるところ、
見たことないわよね。
translation:
Yesterday, Yotsuba was thinking the same thing.
But I don't think I've ever seen Dad drinking alcohol.

japanese:
あー、そういえば。
どうなんだろ、実は飲めなかったりするのかな。
translation:
Ah, now that you mention it...
I start wondering if he can drink alcohol at all.

japanese:
（そういや、あの人、
　前に酒は苦手だって言ってたな）
translation:
(Come to think of it,
 he said he didn't like alcohol before.)

japanese:
（まあ、あの時は親父の誘いを断るために
　言っただけかもしれないが……）
translation:
(Well, he might have said that
 just to refuse Dad's invitation...)

japanese:
酒だとお前らが飲めないし、
どうせなら、全員で食べられる物が
いいんじゃないか？
translation:
Well, you guys can't drink alcohol.
Why not choose something that everyone can eat?

japanese: 全員でって、どうして？
translation: Why everyone?

japanese:
ほら、家族で、この旅行の思い出でも
話しながら食べるとか。
translation:
Well, while eating it with your family you could talk about the 
memories you made during this trip.

japanese: 家族で……。
translation: As a family...

japanese:
へえ、いいかも。
思い出話もお土産にできるし。
translation:
Oh, that's a good idea.
We can turn the memories into souvenirs too.

japanese:
フータロー君とは思えない、
すっごく気が利く提案じゃん。
translation:
That's a really thoughtful suggestion,
not something I'd expect from you, Futaro-kun.

japanese:
まあ、勝手な意見だけどな。
参考になるならしてくれ。
translation:
Well, it's just my opinion.
Please consider it, if its useful to you.

japanese: 風太郎、お父さんのこと気にしてくれてるのね。
translation: Futaro, you care about our father, don't you?

japanese: あー、まあ、そりゃあな。
translation: Well, yeah, of course.

japanese:
（学園祭の時、二乃を連れて
　病院まで乗り込んだこともあるし）
translation:
(I even took Nino to the hospital
 during the school festival.)

japanese:
（なにより、あの時、娘たちとの関係を
　真剣に考えてくれって言われたわけだしな……）
translation:
(And above all, at that time,
 I was told to seriously think about
 my relationship with his daughters...)

japanese:
いずれ、お前と付き合ってることを
報告しなけりゃならねぇ相手なわけだし。
translation: Someday, we have to report him that we're dating.

japanese: 風太郎……。
translation: Futaro...

japanese: おやおや、初々しいねえ２人とも。
translation: Oh yeah, you two are so innocent.

japanese:
正式な報告はまだだとしても、
お父さん、２人が付き合ってることは
知ってるのかな？
translation:
Even though it's not official yet,
does Dad know that you're dating?

japanese: どうだろうな。
translation: I wonder.

japanese: なにそれ、他人事みたいに言わないの。
translation:
You can't just talk about it
like it's someone else's problem, come on.

japanese: まあ、お父さんが怖いって気持ちはわかるけどね？
translation: Well, I understand that you're afraid of our dad.

japanese: べ、別に怖がってなんかないが？
translation: I-I'm not afraid of him, or anything.

japanese:
本当に？
これっぽっちも思ってない？
translation: Really? You don't feel anything at all?

japanese: ……苦手意識があるのは間違いない。
translation: ...I have an aversion to him, that's for sure.

japanese: 認めたね？
translation: So you admit it?

japanese: だが怖がってはいない！
translation: But, I'm not afraid of him!

japanese:
無理しなくていいのよ。
私たちだって、まだお父さんと話すのに
緊張する時があるもの。
translation:
Don't force yourself.
We too get nervous sometimes
when we're talking to him.

japanese:
あ、そうだ！
沖縄土産を持って挨拶するのもありじゃない？
どう、フータロー君。
translation:
Ah, right!
How about greeting him with an Okinawan souvenir?
What do you think, Futaro-kun?

japanese: まあ、きっかけとしてはありか？
translation: Well, as a starting point, it might be a good idea.

japanese:
二乃からは言わなくていいからな。
ちゃんと俺から言う。
translation:
You don't need to say anything, Nino.
I'll explain things myself.

japanese: お？　頑張るねぇ男の子。
translation: Oh? Give it your best shot Futaro-kun.

japanese:
当然のことだろ。
それに、二乃から言ってもらってちゃ、
あの人の信頼を得ることなんてできやしない。
translation:
Of course, I'll give my best!
Besides, even if Nino tells her dad,
we won't be able to gain his trust.

japanese: 風太郎……！
translation: Futaro...!

japanese:
ふふ、いざって時はちゃんと決めてくれるんだから。
二乃も幸せ者だなー。
translation:
Teehee, he'll make a decision when the time is right.
Nino is a lucky girl.

japanese: おい、茶化すな。
translation: Hey, don't make fun of me.

japanese: 茶化してないよ、本当にそう思ってるだけ。
translation:
I'm not making fun of you,
I really think that way.

japanese:
ああ、これで私も安心して
可愛い妹を送り出せる……！
translation:
Ah, now I can send off my cute little sister
with peace of mind...!

japanese: 本当に茶化してないよな？
translation: You're really not making fun of me, right?

japanese:
うん、本気で思ってる。
二乃を幸せにしてくれるよね、フータロー君？
translation:
Yes, I really mean it.
You'll make Nino happy, right Futaro-kun?

japanese:
お、おう。
当然だろ、任せとけ。
translation: Y-yeah. Of course, leave it to me.

japanese:
も、もう一花！
なんで急にそんな話になってるのよ！
translation:
W-wait, Miku!
Why did the conversation suddenly turned this way?

japanese:
あ、そうだ！
沖縄土産を持って挨拶するのもありじゃない？
どう、フータロー君。
translation:
Ah, right!
How about greeting him with an Okinawan souvenir?
What do you think, Futaro-kun?

japanese: まあ、きっかけとしてはありか？
translation: Well, as a starting point, it might be a good idea.

japanese: 察してはいるだろうな。
translation: He probably senses it.

japanese:
どうしてそう思うのよ。
あの人、半年前までは
私たちをほったらかしにしてたのよ？
translation:
Why do you think that?
Dad left us alone and only returned six months ago.

japanese: どうしてって、そりゃ父親だからだ。
translation: He'll sense it because he's your father.

japanese:
お前だって、なんとなくは
わかってきてるんじゃないか？
translation: You're starting to understand it too, aren't you?

japanese:
（血は繋がっていないとしても、
　あの人のお前たちに対する想いが
　どれだけのものなのか……）
translation:
(Even if you're not blood-related,
 your dad has deep feelings for you guys...)

japanese:
……そうね。
私たちのお父さんなんだから。
translation:
...That's right.
He is our dad after all.

japanese: まだちょっと慣れないところもあるけどね。
translation: But we still need some time to get used to it.

japanese:
それは……お互い様よ。
お父さんも私たちも。
translation:
It's...a two-way street.
For Dad and for us.

japanese:
まだ半年だもの。
いままでの分を埋めるには、全然足りないわ。
translation:
It's only been half a year,
so we still have a lot of catching up to do.

japanese:
あ、そうだ！
沖縄土産を持って挨拶するのもありじゃない？
どう、フータロー君。
translation:
Ah, right!
How about greeting him with an Okinawan souvenir?
What do you think, Futaro-kun?

japanese: まあ、きっかけとしてはありか？
translation: Well, as a starting point, it might be a good idea.

japanese:
しかし、いまの俺の財力じゃ
ろくなものが買えそうにないんだが。
translation:
However, with my current financial situation,
I might not be able to afford anything decent.

japanese:
その辺で売っている土産物なんかじゃ
失礼に当たるかもしれないよな……。
translation:
Buying a local souvenir just from anywhere
might be considered rude...

japanese:
まだ高校を卒業したばかりだもの。
気にすることないと思うわ。
translation:
We just graduated from high school,
so there's nothing to worry about.

japanese:
あと、こういうのはお金じゃないでしょ。
気持ちが大切なのよ、気持ちが。
translation:
Besides, it's not about the money.
It's the thought that counts, the THOUGHT.

japanese:
フータロー君がお父さんのために選んだお土産、
ってところがポイントになりそう。
translation:
The point is to show that the souvenir
is one that you, Futaro-kun,
has chosen to give Dad.

japanese:
うげ……。
そのプレッシャーはキツいんだが……。
translation:
Ugh...
The pressure is on...

japanese:
（まあ、なんにせよ
　いつかはお父さんにきちんと挨拶しないとな）
translation:
(Well, at any rate,
 I'll have to properly greet their father someday.)
